title: How to Arrange a Ball of Flowers with an Oasis

steps.headline: Select your flower type.
steps.description: This article uses carnations to demonstrate the project. However, you are free to use any full bloomed flower of your choice.

steps.headline: Cut the stems.
steps.description: Cut the stems with your scissors at 3cm. Always cut stems on an angle, to enable maximum water absorption.

steps.headline: Arrange the flowers:
steps.description: Start at the top and push the stem of your first flower into the oasis, ensuring it sinks all the way into the foam base. Continue in a straight line until the ball is ringed with flowers. Make a line halfway around and fill in the quarters. Ensure the flowers are evenly placed with no gaps.

steps.headline: Display the ball.
steps.description: Gently place your ball of carnations in the middle of your table. This should make the perfect decoration for a table.
